physical_examinations.vital_signs: Birthweight: 3960 g, Birth length: 50 cm, Head circumference: 36 cm, Apgar score: 9, 10, 10 at 1, 5, and 10 minutes respectively.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral anophthalmia, bilateral cleft lip and palate, micropenis, persistent hypoglycemia, hypernatremia, polyuria, and diabetes insipidus. At 6 days, hormone levels showed panhypopituitarism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, nausea and vomiting improved after hormone replacement therapy. Hypernatremia and polyuria developed by 24 days of age.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: TSH: 2.66 mU/L, Free T4: 0.6 ng/dL, GH: 0.38 ng/mL, IGF-1: 31 ng/mL, ACTH: <56 pg/mL, Cortisol: 0 mg/dL, LH: <0.1 U/L, FSH: <0.1 U/L, Testosterone: <0.1 ng/dL, Prolactin: 43.5 mg/L.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Lab assessment revealed panhypopituitarism with detectable levels of pituitary hormones.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Sodium plasma: 150 mEq/L, Potassium plasma: 4.4 mEq/L, Plasma osmolality: 310 mOSM/kg H2O, Urine osmolality: 178 mOSM/kg H2O.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Confirmed diabetes insipidus, treated with oral desmopressin.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hyperthermia noted daily without signs of infection or inflammation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Episodes of temperature instability interpreted as hypothalamic instability.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 3 months, developed bacterial meningitis secondary to otitis media.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cleft lip and palate repaired; ear tubes inserted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Frequent episodes of otitis media continued.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Growth followed the 50th percentile for height, head circumference, and weight.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Circadian sleep rhythm not acquired; melatonin substitution started.
